Macros
SOC Driver Internal Definitions
SOC Driver

The section has a list of all internal definitions which are used internally by the SOC module. More...

Macros

#define SOC_TRANSLATEADDR_NUM_ENTRIES   3
 This defines the number of LUT entries for address translation. The contiguous address ranges are consolidated as much as possible to limit the time spent in lookup actions.
 
#define SOC_TRANSLATEADDR_NUM_ENTRIES   4
 This defines the number of LUT entries for address translation. The contiguous address ranges are consolidated as much as possible to limit the time spent in lookup actions.
 
#define SOC_TRANSLATEADDR_NUM_ENTRIES   4
 This defines the number of LUT entries for address translation. The contiguous address ranges are consolidated as much as possible to limit the time spent in lookup actions.
 
#define SOC_TRANSLATEADDR_NUM_ENTRIES   4
 This defines the number of LUT entries for address translation. The contiguous address ranges are consolidated as much as possible to limit the time spent in lookup actions.
 
#define SOC_MAX_SYSTEM_INTERRUPT   4U
 The SOC Driver is responsible for the registration and handling of system interrupts. It then provides applications and drivers to register their interrupts which are then invoked in the order of registration. The definition is the maximum number of system interrupts which are supported by this model.
 
#define SOC_MAX_LISTEN_TABLE   4U
 This definition exposes the maximum number of listeners which can be attached to a system interrupt.
 
#define ONE_KB   (1024U)
 Defines used to ensure memory programmed as MPU base address is aligned to 1KB.
 
#define ONE_MB   (ONE_KB * ONE_KB)
 Defines used to ensure memory programmed as MPU base address is aligned to 1MB.
 

Detailed Description

The section has a list of all internal definitions which are used internally by the SOC module.
